moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Nf6 3. Nf3 e6 4. Bb5+ c: The knight cannot be easily kicked, anf if exchanged, the center is solid.
moves.9. c3 O-O 10. Qc2: Threatening my weak kingside. I have to play very carefully.
moves.10... Nd7: The other knight will help the kingside.
moves.11. Be3: NxB will open the f column.
moves.11... Nd7f6 12. h3: Preventing Ng5, but better was a quick attack on h2, with Bd3, Ng5...
moves.13. b3 Ba6: Making use of my useless lsb.
moves.14. Bxa6 Qxa6: My queen is not well placed, though...
moves.16... Nxf4 17. c4: My kinside is kind of safe, now.
moves.17... Rfd8: A loss of tempo. This rook is doing anything there.
moves.19. Neg5 Ng6: NO time to to think in attacking, but defending. I was worried about h4, though...
moves.20. Nxe6: Interesting, but I think it doesn't give enough compensation.
moves.21. Ng5 c5: My queen is again in the game!
moves.22. d5 exd5: Opening the way for my queen.
moves.23. cxd5 Nf6: Solid kingside defence, and threatening d4.
moves.25... Qd3 26. Qb2 Rg5: Now it's me who is threatening his king...
moves.27... Qxh3 28. f3 Nh4: Wow, now it's my turn to attack...
moves.29. Qd2: R to the second rank was due.
moves.29... Rg6: ? A mistake. Rxg2+ was called for. Still threatening g2, though...
moves.31. Qc4+ Kh8: He resigned here. Kf2 was the only move to resist a little longer.
